prompt: <description>Part 1 Create the base for the rectangular prism with a curved side Construct a new coordinate system for the base part with Euler angles of -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system with the following components: - A rectangle with four lines. The lines are as follows: 1. line\\_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.0] 2. line\\_2: Start Point = [0.75, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.15] 3. line\\_3: Start Point = [0.75, 0.15], End Point = [0.0, 0.15] 4. line\\_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.15], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop and exit the sketching environment. Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch\\_scale parameter set to 0.75. Transform the plane of the 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles [-90, 0, -90] and a translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.0187 towards the normal and 0.0 opposite the normal, and a sketch\\_scale of 0.75 for the new body feature operation. Part 2 Create the curved side of the rectangular prism Construct a new coordinate system for the second part with Euler angles of -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 and a translation vector of [0.0188, 0.3312, 0.1062]. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system with the following components: - A curved side with an arc and a line. 1. line\\_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0438], End Point = [0.0875, 0.0438] 2. arc\\_1: Start Point = [0.0875, 0.0438], Mid Point = [0.0438, 0.0], End Point = [0.0, 0.0438] Close the loop and exit the sketching environment. Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch\\_scale parameter set to 0.0875. Transform the plane of the 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles [-90, 0, -90] and a translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.0 towards the normal and 0.025 opposite the normal, and a sketch\\_scale of 0.0875 for the cut feature operation. Follow the same process for the remaining parts, if any, and complete the final cad model assembly using the given information in the CAD assembly JSON file.</description>

Creating the 3D Model 1. The 2D sketch will need to be scaled before extrusion. Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to the sketch. 2. Next, apply a transformation to the scaled 2D sketch in order to create a 3D sketch. The euler angles are set to 0.0, 0.0, -90.0. The translation vector is set to 0.0, 0.03, 0.0. 3. Extrude the 2D sketch to create the final 3D model for the first part. Extrude by a depth of 0.03 towards the normal direction and 0.0 in the opposite direction. Summary: The final shape is a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other, and the sides are perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The top and bottom faces are equidistant from the center of the object. The object is centered in the image. The height is 0.75, the width is 0.03, and the length is 0.75. Deliverables: Share the CAD file containing the coordinates, sketches, and extrusion specifications of the completed first part with the team.
